slides.title: QURANIC FOUNDATION OF MARRIAGE

quranVerse.arabic: And among His signs is that He created for you spouses from among yourselves so that you may find comfort in them. And He has placed between you compassion and mercy. Surely in this are signs for people who reflect.

teachings: Spouses are meant to bring comfort
slides.closing: Marriage is a sacred bond, not just a contract.

slides.title: Islamic Scholar Explains Marriage in Islam
WHAT IS MARRIAGE?
slides.definition: Marriage is a bond that ties two lives into one. Whatever happiness and pain either experiences, both will experience together.

principles.heading: Key Islamic Principles:
items: Marriage is worship when done with right intention

slides.closing: This is not just romance - it's a lifelong partnership.

slides.title: PURPOSES OF MARRIAGE IN ISLAM
slides.closing: All these purposes work together to create a strong, blessed marriage.

content.title: MARRIAGE: A STRONG COVENANT

quranVerse.text: And they have taken from you a strong covenant (mithaqan ghaleedha)

content.context: This is the SAME word used for: Covenant with the Prophets, Very serious agreements in Islam
content.emphasis: Marriage is ONE OF THE MOST SERIOUS commitments you will ever make.
content.instruction: To confirm you understand the seriousness of marriage as a covenant, both partners copy and paste this exact text:
content.requiredText: I understand that marriage is a strong covenant (mithaqan ghaleedha) before Allah, requiring serious commitment, mutual rights and responsibilities, and lifelong effort. I enter this marriage with full awareness of its sacred nature.

slides.title: YOUR LEGAL RIGHT TO MARRY
slides.quote: Every citizen has the right to marry based on mutual consent and free choice.
slides.note: This is both an Islamic principle AND constitutional right.

freeChoiceIncludes.heading: FREE CHOICE includes:
items: Choosing to marry or not marry
Ending engagement if you change your mind

slides.title: ⚠️ FORCED MARRIAGE IS ILLEGAL ⚠️
slides.offense: Forcing someone to marry is a CRIMINAL OFFENSE.
includes: Emotional pressure that removes free choice

ifBeingForced.heading: If you are being forced to marry:

emphasis: You have the legal right to refuse.
No one can force you into marriage.
If you witness forced marriage: REPORT IT. You could save someone's life.

slides.title: UNDERSTANDING MAHRU (DOWRY)
slides.definition: A gift from the husband to the wife at the time of marriage.

keyFacts.title: IT IS THE WIFE'S ABSOLUTE RIGHT
THE WIFE DECIDES THE AMOUNT
keyFacts.detail: She sets it based on her preference. No maximum or minimum in Islam. (Maldivian practice: often negotiated)

keyFacts.title: IT BECOMES HER PROPERTY AT NIKAH
keyFacts.detail: Belongs entirely to her. She can use it however she wants.

keyFacts.title: FAMILY CANNOT TAKE IT
keyFacts.detail: It's not for her family. It's not for the wedding expenses. It's HER money.

keyFacts.title: SHE CAN CLAIM IT IN COURT
keyFacts.detail: If husband doesn't pay, she can sue.

slides.closing: The mahru symbolizes the husband's commitment and the wife's value. It is her financial security.

slides.title: HUSBAND'S RESPONSIBILITIES
otherDuties: MAHRU PAYMENT: Must pay the agreed mahru (Wife can claim in court if unpaid)
GOOD TREATMENT: Treat wife with kindness, Respect and dignity, Good character, Cannot force her to do haram
slides.important: These are MINIMUM requirements, not maximum. A good husband does MORE than the minimum.
slides.hadith: The best of you are those who are best to their wives. - Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

content.title: WIFE'S FINANCIAL RIGHTS
rights: Her salary - she keeps it ALL
NOT obligated to spend on household
additionalRights: She can work without husband's permission
content.criticalUnderstanding: Marriage does NOT remove these rights.
husbandCannot: Prevent her from working (though can discuss)
content.consequences: If a husband violates these rights, it may be grounds for divorce AND legal action.
content.instruction: To confirm you understand the wife's financial rights, both partners copy and paste:
content.requiredText: I understand that the wife's earnings, property, inheritance, and mahru belong entirely to her. She is not obligated to spend on the household. Her financial rights are protected by both Islamic law and Maldivian law.

slides.title: CULTURAL vs RELIGIOUS PRACTICES
slides.introduction: It's important to distinguish between: What Islam REQUIRES vs What culture EXPECTS

cultural.heading: CULTURAL (NOT required, optional):
items: Specific mahru amounts based on status

yourChoice.heading: YOU CAN CHOOSE:
items: Live independently or with family (your choice)

slides.warning: Don't let cultural pressure force you into: Debt for wedding expenses, Living situations you don't want, Giving up your Islamic rights
slides.closing: Culture can be beautiful, but it doesn't override Islamic principles or your rights. Discuss what YOU want, not just what others expect.

slides.title: COMMON MISCONCEPTIONS ABOUT MARRIAGE

misconceptions.myth: Wife must ask permission for everything
misconceptions.truth: Islam gives women autonomy in many areas. She can manage her money, visit family, make decisions about her own affairs.

misconceptions.myth: Husband can prevent wife from working
misconceptions.truth: Wife has right to work. While spouses should discuss major decisions, he cannot simply forbid her employment.

misconceptions.myth: In-laws have authority over the couple
misconceptions.truth: Primary relationship is between husband and wife. In-laws can advise but shouldn't control decisions.

misconceptions.myth: Wife must tolerate abuse to keep family together
misconceptions.truth: Islam absolutely forbids oppression (dhulm). Wife has right to safety and can divorce if abused.

misconceptions.myth: Husband owns everything including wife's salary
misconceptions.truth: Wife's earnings are entirely hers. Husband has NO right to take or control her money.
While divorce is disliked, it's permitted when necessary. Better than staying in harmful marriage.
Mahru belongs ONLY to the wife, not her family.
Legal registration with Family Court is required for marriage to be recognized by the state.

slides.closing: Don't build your marriage on myths. Build it on truth.
